The Supplication: For use in the Litany in place of the Versicle and Collect which follows the Lord’s Prayer; or at the end of Morning or Evening Prayer; or as a separate devotion. The Supplication is especially appropriate in times of war, or of great anxiety, or of disaster.
heading: rubric

The Supplication: O Lord, arise and help us;
heading: leader

The Supplication: And deliver us for thy Name’s sake.
heading: congregation

The Supplication: O God, we have heard with our ears, and our fathers have declared unto us, the noble works that thou didst in their days, and in the old time before them.
heading: leader

The Supplication: O Lord, arise and help us;
heading: leader

The Supplication: And deliver us for thy Name’s sake.
heading: congregation

The Supplication: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost; as it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end.
heading: leader

The Supplication: Amen.
heading: congregation

The Supplication: O Lord, arise and help us;
heading: leader

The Supplication: And deliver us for thy Name’s sake
heading: congregation

The Supplication: From our enemies defend us, O Christ;
heading: leader

The Supplication: Graciously behold our afflictions.
heading: congregation

The Supplication: Pitifully behold the sorrows of our hearts;
heading: leader

The Supplication: Mercifully forgive the sins of thy people.
heading: congregation

The Supplication: Favorably with mercy;
heading: leader

The Supplication: O Son of David, have mercy upon us.
heading: congregation

The Supplication: Be thou pleased to hear us, O Christ;
heading: leader

The Supplication: Graciously hear us, O Christ; graciously hear us, O Lord Christ.
heading: congregation

The Supplication: The Officiant prays
heading: rubric

The Supplication: Let us pray.
heading: leader

The Supplication: Look mercifully, O Father, on our infirmities; and, for the glory of thy Name, rescue us from all those evils we now endure; and grant that in all our troubles we may put our whole trust and confidence in thy mercy, serving thee in holiness and purity of life, to thy honor and glory; through our only Mediator and Advocate, Jesus Christ our Lord.
heading: leader

The Supplication: Amen.
heading: congregation
